name.pehl.piriti.client.json
Interface JsonReader<T>

Type Parameters:
T - The type
All Known Subinterfaces:
JsonModelReader<T>
public interface JsonReader<T>

Interface for converting JSON data to an instance of T or a list of Ts. The implementation for this interface is generated using deferred binding. All fields of T which are annotated with JsonField are handled by the generated JsonReader implementation. If the path expression behind JsonField returns some data != null the relevant field is assigned with the converted value, otherwise the field remains unchanged.

Please note that the annotated fields in T must not be private!

The setup of the XmlReader is inspired by the UiBinder and is typically specified as an inner class: 

 pubilc ModalGirlfriendMediator
 {
     interface Reader extends JsonReader<ModalGirlfriendMediator> {}
     public static final Reader JSON = GWT.create(Reader.class);
     
     // The fields of this POJO annotated with JsonField.
 }
JSON data can then be converted to an instance of ModalGirlfriendMediator by calling 
 String jsonString = ...;
 ModalGirlfriendMediator mgm = ModalGirlfriendMediator.JSON.read(jsonString);

Version:
$LastChangedRevision: 46 $
Author:
$LastChangedBy: harald.pehl $

Method Detail

read

T read(@Nullable
       String jsonString)
Convert the specified JSON string to an instance of T according to the annotated fields in T. The JSON string must be a valid JSON object with key/value pairs.

Please note that the JSON string is parsed using JSONParser.parse(String) which in turn uses the JavaScript eval() function. So please *do not* pass an untrusted string into this method.

Parameters:
jsonString - The JSON string used as input. May be null.
Returns:
An instance of T with the mapped JSON data or null if the JSON string was null.

read

T read(@Nullable
       JSONObject jsonObject)
Convert the specified JSON object to an instance of T according to the annotated fields in T.

Parameters:
jsonObject - The JSON object used as input. May be null.
Returns:
An instance of T with the mapped JSON data or null if the JSON object was null.

readList

List<T> readList(@Nullable
                 String jsonString)
Convert the specified JSON string to a list of Ts according to the annotated fields in T. The JSON string must be a valid JSON object with one key/value pair. The value must be JSON array which converted to the list of Ts.

Please note that the JSON string is parsed using JSONParser.parse(String) which in turn uses the JavaScript eval() function. So please *do not* pass an untrusted string into this method.

Parameters:
jsonString - The JSON string used as input. May be null.
Returns:
A list of T instances with the mapped JSON data or null if the JSON string was null.

readList

List<T> readList(@Nullable
                 String jsonString,
                 String arrayKey)
Convert the specified JSON string to a list of Ts according to the annotated fields in T. The JSON string must be a valid JSON object with key/value pairs. The array is taken from the specified key and is converted to the list of Ts.

Please note that the JSON string is parsed using JSONParser.parse(String) which in turn uses the JavaScript eval() function. So please *do not* pass an untrusted string into this method.

Parameters:
jsonString - The JSON string used as input. May be null.
Returns:
A list of T instances with the mapped JSON data or null if the JSON string was null.

readList

List<T> readList(@Nullable
                 JSONObject jsonObject)
Convert the specified JSON object to a list of Ts according to the annotated fields in T. The JSON object must contain one key/value pair. The value must be JSON array which converted to the list of Ts.

Please note that the JSON string is parsed using JSONParser.parse(String) which in turn uses the JavaScript eval() function. So please *do not* pass an untrusted string into this method.

Parameters:
jsonString - The JSON string used as input. May be null.
Returns:
A list of T instances with the mapped JSON data or null if the JSON string was null.

readList

List<T> readList(@Nullable
                 JSONObject jsonObject,
                 String arrayKey)
Convert the specified JSON object to a list of Ts according to the annotated fields in T. The JSON object must contains the specified array. This array is converted to the list of Ts.

Please note that the JSON string is parsed using JSONParser.parse(String) which in turn uses the JavaScript eval() function. So please *do not* pass an untrusted string into this method.

Parameters:
jsonString - The JSON string used as input. May be null.
Returns:
A list of T instances with the mapped JSON data or null if the JSON string was null.

readList

List<T> readList(@Nullable
                 JSONArray jsonArray)
Convert the specified JSON array to a list of Ts according to the annotated fields in T.

Parameters:
jsonArray - The JSON array used as input. May be null.
Returns:
A list of T instances with the mapped JSON data or null if the JSON array was null.
